head.title: Metro Briefing | New York: Manhattan: Hoboken Councilman Charged With Drunken Driving

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New York: Manhattan: Hoboken Councilman Charged With Drunken Driving
hedline.hl2: Manhattan: Hoboken Councilman Charged With Drunken Driving

body.head.byline: By ANAHAD O'CONNOR; Compiled by John Sullivan

abstract.p: Hoboken, NJ, Councilman Christopher Campos is charged with drunken driving in New York City (S)

block.p: A Hoboken city councilman has been arrested and charged with driving while intoxicated, the police said yesterday. The councilman, Christopher Campos, was stopped on the West Side Highway near 43rd Street in Manhattan just after 3 a.m. on Saturday for running a red light, the police said. Officers administered a Breathalyzer test to Mr. Campos because they smelled alcohol, the police said, adding that he failed the test. Mr. Campos spent the night in jail and was arraigned and then released.
